questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company is using Microsoft 365.

The company has several reporting requirements, including that it must be able to view:

• Information about security trends and track the protection status of identities, data, devices, apps, and infrastructure.
• Status and trends for the compliance of Microsoft 365 devices, data, identities, apps, and infrastructure.
• Activity reports that include device registration and usage, and user sign-in activity.

You need to recommend the correct admin center for the company to use based on its reporting requirements.

Which admin center should you use? To answer, move the appropriate admin center to the correct reporting requirement. You may use each admin center once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to move the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Correct

You have a Teams deployment.

You need to apply bandwidth restrictions for Teams users in the Buffalo office. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• The media bit rate must be a maximum of 1 Mbps.
• Users that travel between the offices must have access to high-quality video while in the New York office.

Which two features should you configure? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

I believe the answer is A for 2 reasons

First of all, "Office 365 Proplus" was the old name for "M365 Apps for Enterprises" (see: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/new-subscription-names?view=o365-worldwide)

Secondly, just like M365 Apps for business, M365 apps for Enterprises ALLOWS desktop apps and does NOT include teams Service except for a "Explorative version" (see: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/enterprise/microsoft-365-apps-for-enterprise-product?activetab=pivot:overviewtab)

Answer C & D would be overkill

comments.content: Microsoft has renamed Office 365 ProPlus to Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise. This change was made to reflect the broad set of features and benefits in the subscription, beyond just the desktop applications.

C. Office 365 E3: This license includes the desktop and online versions of Office applications, as well as email hosting, access to Microsoft Teams, and audio-conferencing capabilities. So it meets the requirements for the department needing desktop products and not requiring audio-conferencing, while also providing the option for audio-conferencing if needed in the future. Therefore, it is the correct option.

D. Office 365 E5: This license includes all the features of Office 365 E3, as well as advanced security and compliance features, such as advanced threat protection and eDiscovery. While it meets the requirements for the department needing desktop products and not requiring audio-conferencing, it includes more features than necessary and may be a more expensive option. Therefore, it is not the optimal option.

A. Office 365 ProPlus: This license includes the desktop versions of Office applications, such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, but it does not include audio-conferencing capabilities. So while it meets the requirement for the department needing desktop products, it does not fulfill the need for audio-conferencing. Therefore, it is not the correct option.

B. Microsoft 365 E1: This license includes the online versions of Office applications, as well as email hosting and access to Microsoft Teams, but it does not include audio-conferencing capabilities. So while it meets the requirement for the department needing desktop products, it does not fulfill the need for audio-conferencing. Therefore, it is not the correct option.

discussion.content: The license that would fit the requirements described in the scenario is Office 365 E3. This license includes the full suite of Office desktop products, such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and others, as well as other features such as email, file storage, and sharing, and Microsoft Teams. It does not include audio-conferencing, which is not required by the department according to the scenario. On the other hand, Microsoft 365 E1 does not include the Office desktop products, which are required by the department, and Office 365 ProPlus and Office 365 E5 include additional features that may not be necessary for the department and are more expensive than the Office 365 E3 license.

Selected Answer: C
The license that would help achieve this is C. Office 365 E3.

Office 365 ProPlus includes audio-conferencing capabilities in addition to the desktop products, which the department does not require.

Microsoft 365 E1 includes web-based Office applications but not the desktop products, which are required by the department.

Office 365 E5 includes audio-conferencing and other advanced capabilities that the department does not need.

Office 365 E3 includes the desktop products (such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint) without audio-conferencing capabilities, making it the appropriate license for this situation.

The license that would allow users in a department to access Office desktop products but not audio-conferencing is Office 365 ProPlus.

Office 365 ProPlus is a suite of desktop applications that includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and other productivity applications. It also includes access to OneDrive for Business and SharePoint Online for collaboration and file storage. However, it does not include audio-conferencing capabilities.

Microsoft 365 E1 includes web-based versions of Office applications, Exchange Online, and SharePoint Online, but it does not include the desktop versions of Office applications.

Office 365 E3 and Office 365 E5 both include the desktop versions of Office applications and audio-conferencing capabilities, which would be unnecessary for the department in question.

Therefore, the correct answer is A. Office 365 ProPlus.

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft Office 365 subscription.
As an administrator for this subscription, you have been tasked with assigning Microsoft 365 licenses to users in a department where audio-conferencing is not required. The department does, however, require office desktop products to complete tasks.
Which of the following is the license that would help you achieve this?

comments.content: it says the "user's local device" not just local device

discussion.content:
audiomode:i:0
pool1
The Azure Virtual Desktop host pool setting microphone redirection controls whether to redirect audio input from a local device to an audio application in a remote session. The corresponding RDP property is audiocapturemode:i:<value> 
0: Play sounds on the local device.
1: Play sounds in a remote session.

i think it should be:

audiocapturemode:i 
Pool1

comments.content: it says the audio redirected, not the mic

discussion.content:
